thread.title: Rocketrip targets sharing economy firms network expands
thread.title_full: Rocketrip targets sharing economy firms network expands

title: Rocketrip targets sharing economy firms network expands
text:
Thu, 8 Oct 2015 10:04 Rocketrip has expanded its partner network by targeting sharing economy and Travel 3.0 firms.
The technology company, which sets real-time budgets for each trip and rewards employee with cash or cash incentives for beating them, has struck deals with companies such as Hoteltonight, Uber, Breather, Founderscard and Loungebuddy.
“When employees are rewarded for saving money on travel, they want to find services that will help them cut costs. Through our partner network, they can now find exclusive deals from companies that provide the best values and experiences in the industry,” said Emily Hurd, Rocketrip’s VP business development and marketing.
“The more travelers use our partners’ services, the more money they will save, and the more reward points they will accrue. Our customers and partners both win in that scenariom," she added.
Rocketrip, which signed its first partnership with Virgin America in September, said users can now click ‘Get Perks’ to access the new deals which include credits, discounts and free services.
After signing its first partnership with Virgin America in September, Rocketrip sought out additional partnerships that focus on other areas of travel. From the Rocketrip dashboard, users can now click “Get Perks” to access the new deals from HotelTonight, Breather, FoundersCard, LoungeBuddy, Uber, and more. The perks include credits, discounts and free services.
Read a Q&A BBT did with Rocketrip CEO Dan Ruch
